Faq.question: Where are you located?
Faq.answer: Our beautiful puppies are raised in our home next to the beautiful Wasatch Mountains of Utah. We are located in the City of Orem just 50min south of the Salt Lake City Airport.

Faq.question: What is the price of you Puppies?
Faq.answer: The price of our puppies is dependent on Breed, Size, Color, Coat and Generation. We strive to maintain our prices as low as possible, while still providing our families with quality bred puppies raised with ALL the foundational skills necessary to thrive in their new home.

Faq.question: Standard Sized Puppies:
Faq.answer: Prices on our Standard Puppies range between $2,000-$2,500 Standard adult weight typically starts at 45 pounds and height at 21 inches at the shoulder and goes up from there. We do have standard parents who have thrown puppies or petite standards that fall more in the Moyan size range.

Faq.question: Moyan Sized Puppies:
Faq.answer: Prices on our Moyan (Medium) Puppies range between $2,300-$2,600. Moyan adult weight typically ranges between 30 pounds and 50 pounds and their height approximately 18 inches to 21 inches tall at the shoulder. The Moyan size is more of an in between size from Minis to Standards and be a bit more difficult to predict.

Faq.question: Miniature Puppies:
Faq.answer: Prices on our Mini Puppies range between $2,500-$2,800, Mini adult weight typically ranges between 20 pounds and 35 pounds. Their height is approximately 14 inches to 18 inches tall at the shoulder.

Faq.question: Micro-Miniature Puppies:
Faq.answer: Prices on our Micro-Mini Puppies range between $2,600-$3,000. Micro-Mini adult weight typically remains under 20 pounds and their height stays under 17 inches tall at the shoulder.

Faq.question: Do you deliver or ship your puppies?
Faq.answer: The simple answer to your question is YES for an additional fee! The great thing is there are always options in getting one of our AMAZING pups to you! Whether it be via Flight Nanny, Airline Cargo, Airport Pick-up or Ground Transport flexibility is the key and we will do everything we can to make it go as smoothly as possible.

Faq.question: What is a Flight Nanny?
Faq.answer: A Flight Nanny is a professionally trained individual who provides safe in-cabin transport for your puppy from our local airport to an airport near you. Your puppy remains with the Flight Nanny for the duration of the time they leave us until the puppy is handed over to you at a designated meeting area at destination airport near you. The cost for delivery via a Flight Nanny is determined by the Nanny. Most flights from Utah to any destination in the US typically runs between $500-$800. Please let us know right away if you plan on using this option for your puppy delivery. We MUST book our Nannies as far in advance as possible to unsure we get our desired dates.

Faq.question: Shipping your puppy
Faq.answer: If your puppy weighs over 20 pounds or you’d like to go with this option, your puppy can fly in a hard crate in the Cargo Area of the plane to the airport nearest you. There are restrictions with this option and whenever possible we prefer to go with the Flight Nanny Option first. The fee for Cargo is dependent on the size of the crate/dog but typically runs $450-$650. The cost includes the crate, USDA Vet Health Certificate, airline ticket, and drop-off fee.

Faq.question: Airport Pick up
Faq.answer: We love the opportunity of meeting our puppy families and would be happy to meet you at the passenger drop-off with your new puppy at either the Provo or Salt Lake City Airport. You will need to bring an airline approved soft puppy crate with you.

Faq.question: Ground Transport
Faq.answer: To approved areas within driving distance and starting at a base fee of $200 plus cost/per mile and goes up depending on destination location. We can arrange to meet you part way or deliver your puppy to you.

Faq.question: Breeder air delivery
Faq.answer: A member of our JYMR Doodles Team would be happy to deliver your puppy from the Salt Lake City  Airport to an airport of your choice. Our delivery fee is $400 to $600 plus the cost of a oneway ticket for your puppy and roundtrip ticket for the delivering team member.

Faq.question: Do you require puppy to be Spayed/Neutered?
Faq.answer: Yes, a spay and neuter clause is part of our purchase contract. We require ALL puppies sold as pets to be Spayed or Neutered by 12 months of age or prior to reaching sexual maturity. A vasectomy is also acceptable, as well as a tubal ligation but research shows that leaving the ovaries in a female not being used for breeding can and often does create other issues leaving any breed at a higher risk of developing Cancer. We require proof of the procedure from your vet prior to releasing Registration Information for your puppy.

reviews.testimonial: Rosie is the best dog! She is really cute and cuddly! And she likes to lick a lot! I’m so grateful to have her. She is my best friend and the best dog I could ever have! Love her so much!

I first met Juan and Michelle With JYMR Doodles in the Lehi Cabelas store a couple of years ago. They had the most beautiful standard poodle with them. His name is Cash. He stole my heart as well as their kindness and willingness to answer my questions. In speaking with Michelle I found out about JYMR DOODLES! I had been talking to my John about getting either a labradoodle or golden doodle. When I finally retired the following spring I contacted Michelle. What a great experience! They are very professional. I was impressed by her knowledge and integrity. I picked my pup, we named him Buck and soon went back and purchased another one so our boy would have a great playmate. We named him Roo, so that would be BUCK AND ROO (I used to call my twin boys my little BUCKAROOS).  Long story short JYMR makes it very easy to work with them and they have quality pups. The temperament of my boys is amazing. They want to please and are good listeners. I have had Queensland healers, golden retrievers, and a boarder collie. The Labradoodles are by far the smartest and easiest dogs I have ever had. I wanted my sister in California to have JOY these pups have given me and went back to JYMR and purchased a Minnie labradoodle for my sister. We both cried when we picked her up. Her name is Betsy and I FaceTime with her a couple of times a week with my dogs. If you are looking for a breeder that is there for you and will answer questions and assist you with information, I highly recommend JYMR DOODLES. My pups are very healthy and beautiful.

We bought our F1B mini goldendoodle, Mila (formerly Ash), from JYMR Doodles. Mila was from the Bella and Leo litter, “The A Team.” Michelle and her team spend a lot of time socializing their puppies, and you can definitely tell. Our puppy, Mila, has a happy, outgoing, confident temperament. She has been easy and willing to train and groom. Mila stays calm during all types of sounds, like thunderstorms, music, construction, people knocking at the door, or neighborhood dogs barking. We’ve even had to chainsaw some trees in our yard while she was nearby, and it didn’t bother her a bit! She thinks everyone she meets, animals included, are her best friends. She already had great crate skills and knew a couple of basic commands when we picked her up at 8 weeks old. She slept through the night in her crate from the first week we got her, and she was mostly potty trained by 10 weeks, and now at 17 weeks, she uses a bell to ask to go out to go potty. Mila loves being held, petted, walked, and being around all people. We get compliments about her temperament and cooperation from our vet, groomer, and the entire neighborhood. Mila has also been great with riding in the car from day one. She’s been checked regularly by her vet, who has told us repeatedly that “Mila is in excellent health, and is such a happy puppy.” Our neighbor adopted a puppy that was the same age, at the same time from a DIFFERENT breeder who kept their puppies outside in a kennel, and you can definitely tell the difference from Mila, who was socialized from birth! Our neighbor has had to work extra hard on introducing crate skills and potty training for the first time, and managing their puppy’s anxiety over unusual or loud noises. Our experience with Mila has shown us the importance of early and proper socialization for puppies. Mila is a dream puppy. We researched breeders and waited to get a puppy for a long time until we felt that we had found the right fit, and we are glad we found JYMR DOODLES. We would DEFINITELY recommend JYMR Doodles to anyone looking for a happy, healthy puppy.
